title: EYA 2: When It's Time to Let Go of a Good Thing
description:
Have you ever had to decide to let go of a dream or a good thing?

Maybe you thought the relationship you’re in would lead to marriage or you thought the job you took was your dream job.

Maybe the city you moved to isn’t a fit anymore, the home you thought you would grow old in is becoming too much work, or your schedule has become overwhelming and you can’t do it all.

When we have things in our life that didn’t turn out how we thought they would, or when we take on too much at once, it often leads us to a point where we have to make a decision - and maybe even let go of something that seemed like a good thing.

This can often be one of the hardest decisions to make because letting go feels a lot like giving up and you start to wonder if this makes you a quitter (psst… it doesn’t).

In this episode, Jordan talks all about how to know when to let go of a good thing. This is the second episode in a series that goes along with her new book, Embrace Your Almost.

With additional content that complements chapter 2 of the book and reflection questions to ask yourself, this episode will help you navigate letting go of something good and making space for what’s better.

Tune in to learn:

  • Why prioritizing space in your life is important
  • What to do when letting go feels like quitting
  • 3 key steps to follow to let go of a good thing
  • How to make decisions that are in line with your priorities

Want to dig deeper?

  • Get a copy of Embrace Your Almost: https://jordanleedooley.com/eya
  • Download the free book guide: https://jlmedia.lpages.co/eya-book-study-guide/ 
  • Start the Bible study plan: https://www.bible.com/reading-plans/30872
author: matt@jordanleedooley.com (Jordan Lee Dooley)
